description:
Google accountants are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports -- and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, advocate best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • CPA, CA or other professional accounting accreditation.
  • 7 years of experience in public accounting and/or public multinational companies.
  • Experience with ERP systems.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with BlackLine and related modules.
  • Experience with global balance sheets and multiple region and entity related reconciliations.
  • Proficiency in spreadsheet and presentation software.
  • Ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and lead and drive complex initiatives.
  • Exceptional technical accounting, analytical, project management, and process improvement skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage monthly balance sheet and reconciliation close activities and present month-end balance sheet results to management.
  • Identify opportunities to centralize, eliminate, automate, or outsource activities relating to Alphabet’s balance sheet and reconciliations.
  • Review processes and implement controls to ensure we are mitigating risk for Alphabet’s balance sheet and reconciliations. Assist in implementation of new balance sheet and reconciliation related systems, upgrades, and automation of accounting processes.
  • Manage, establish, and implement global processes for the accounting of new balance sheet and reconciliation initiatives, ensuring SOX compliance and operational excellence.
  • Prepare for and assist with balance sheet and reconciliation related internal, SOX, and external audits. Document balance sheet processes, ensure performance of key balance sheet controls, and obtain/provide support as necessary.
title: Senior Accountant, Systems and Reporting
